Course Description: THIS COURSE INTRODUCES THE STUDENT TO THE USE OF COMPUTERS FOR PREPARING AND ANALYZING ACCOUNTING RECORDS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
IDENTIFY AND DETERMINE THE APPROPRIATE ACCOUNTING APPLICATIONS OF ELECTRONIC
DATA PROCESSING OPTIONS.
 PROPERLY PREPARE DAILY TRANSACTIONS IN THE ACCOUNTING RECORDS USING POPULAR SOFTWARE, SUCH AS QUICKBOOKS.
 UTILIZE ACCOUNTING SOFTWARE TO CORRECTLY ENTER ADJUSTING JOURNAL ENTRIES IN THE GENERAL JOURNAL SYSTEM.
 CALCULATE AND PREPARE BASIC PAYROLL PAYMENT AND TAX USING POPULAR SOFTWARE, SUCH AS QUICKBOOKS.
 PROPERLY ENTER PAYROLL AND TAX JOURNAL ENTRIES USING POPULAR SOFTWARE, SUCH AS QUICKBOOKS.
 INTERPRET BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS AND PROPERLY USE COMPUTERIZED ACCOUNTING INFORMATION IN ORDER TO MAKE SOUND FINANCIAL DECISIONS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
